meanings.definition: The quality of dissuading or deterring someone from a course of action.
meanings.sent1: Her dissuasiveness was evident when she convinced her friend not to skip school.
meanings.sent2: The dissuasiveness of the warning signs prevented people from entering the dangerous area.
meanings.sent3: The dissuasiveness of the teacher's glare made the students think twice about misbehaving.
meanings.sent4: The dissuasiveness of the security system was likened to a fortress protecting the building.
meanings.sent5: The dissuasiveness of the guard dog's bark made intruders reconsider their plan.

meanings.definition: The ability to persuade someone not to do something.
meanings.sent1: His dissuasiveness in convincing his brother not to eat all the cookies was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The dissuasiveness of her argument made her parents change their minds about the curfew.
meanings.sent3: The dissuasiveness of the cat's meow made the owner give in and open the door.
meanings.sent4: Her dissuasiveness in negotiations was like a skilled diplomat avoiding conflict.
meanings.sent5: The dissuasiveness of the child's pout made it hard for the babysitter to say no.
